title: How Auditors Can Use Generative AI to Streamline ESG Audits
originSummary: Generative AI (GenAI) has the potential to streamline ESG audits by automating research, data collection, and analysis, enhancing stakeholder management, and facilitating comprehensive ESG reporting.

Auditors must be wary of challenges such as the risk of hallucinations in AI responses, complex implementation processes, regulatory concerns, and data security to ensure ethical and responsible use of GenAI.

Tips for successful implementation include using managed services within cloud platforms, leveraging pre-trained models from reputable sources, testing prompts in simulation environments, and utilizing advanced prompting techniques.

title: How ServiceNow's generative AI capabilities disrupt third-party developers in automation
originSummary: ServiceNow has launched generative AI capabilities on its Now Platform, enabling businesses to automate responses, triage tickets, and increase productivity.
This release may be a challenge for third-party software developers who previously offered AI-powered automation solutions.

ServiceNow CIO Chris Bedi highlights the benefits of integrating functionality on a single platform and emphasizes the advantages of generative AI in enhancing the user experience and speeding up digital transformation efforts.
Bedi advises CIOs to measure the success of generative AI applications using metrics like sentiment, adoption, coverage, and business impact.

title: Wolfram Research Introduces Plugin to Enhance Reliability of OpenAI's ChatGPT
originSummary: Wolfram Research has developed a plugin for OpenAI's ChatGPT to combat reliability issues and hallucination in the AI language model.
ChatGPT has been found to generate false information at rates of 15% to 27%, leading to reliability concerns.
Wolfram's plugin injects objectivity into ChatGPT by providing accurate mathematics, curated knowledge, real-time data, and visualization, improving the reliability of its responses.

title: AI Job Postings Increase, but Integration Outweighs Job Displacement
originSummary: Job postings mentioning AI have increased significantly by 20 times since the beginning of the year, according to job website Indeed.
AI is not taking over entire jobs but being integrated into work in specific job functions, such as writing marketing copy.
The rise of AI technology has sparked concerns about potential misuse and displacement of workers, leading to calls for regulators to establish safeguards.

title: Salesforce Boosts Sales Cloud with New Generative AI Features
originSummary: Salesforce is enhancing its Sales Cloud platform with additional generative AI features to support sales teams in boosting productivity and efficiency.
The new features encompass an AI assistant, call summarization and exploration, a sales email tool, an automated prospecting tool, and process intelligence.

These updates are intended to minimize manual tasks and enhance the performance of sales teams, contributing to Salesforce's ongoing investment in AI research and development across its cloud applications.

title: Unlocking the Potential of Generative AI in APAC: Improving Customer Experiences with Real-Time Data Streaming
originSummary: Generative AI is gaining popularity in the APAC region, as businesses aim to leverage its capabilities in providing near-human responses and enhancing customer experiences.
This technology combines real-time data streaming, machine learning models, and natural language processing to efficiently handle inquiries.

Generative AI has the potential to revolutionize customer service, research, and advertising by offering faster and more relevant responses, although its adoption may face obstacles such as a shortage of skilled personnel and concerns about job displacement.

title: Generative AI: Streamlining Incident Management Processes through Automation and Efficiency
originSummary: Organizations are facing challenges in adhering to incident management processes and resolving service incidents quickly.
Generative AI is being seen as a solution to streamline incident management processes and improve efficiency.
The integration of generative AI capabilities into incident management tools can decrease the time it takes to create new automations and improve job performance and incident resolution.

title: Shell Explores Potential of Generative AI in Energy Industry
originSummary: Shell's Head of AI, Amy Challen, spoke at the Web Summit conference about the company's use of generative AI in the energy industry.
Challen highlighted the potential of generative AI in HR, contracting, customer support, and knowledge management.
She also discussed the risks associated with generative AI, such as cybersecurity and bias, and stressed the need for human oversight.

title: Leveraging the K-12 Generative AI Readiness Checklist: A Guide for School Districts
originSummary: The Council of Great City Schools, CoSN, and Amazon Web Services have collaborated to create the K-12 Gen AI Readiness Checklist Questionnaire.
The checklist helps school districts prepare for integrating generative AI into their educational systems.
The checklist covers aspects like executive leadership, operational readiness, data, technical readiness, security, and legal/risk management.
Districts are encouraged to form a Generative AI Leadership Team and involve key decision-makers and cross-functional teams in the assessment process.
The checklist can be customized to meet each district's unique needs and challenges.
Districts can contribute their experiences and modifications to the checklist as a community resource.
The goal is to strategically use AI technology in line with educational objectives while ensuring data privacy and security.
